```{r}
set.seed(10)
train_folds <- train2 %>% vfold_cv(v = 3)
```

## logistic model

```{r}
library(stacks)
logistic_model <- logistic_reg(penalty = 0.01) %>%
                set_engine("glmnet")

workflow <- 
  workflow() %>%
  add_recipe(recipe_2) %>%
  add_model(logistic_model)

crossval_fit_1 <- 
  workflow %>%
  fit_resamples(train_folds)

crossval_fit_1 %>% 
  collect_metrics()

log_res <- 
  tune_grid(
  workflow,
  resamples = train_folds,
  grid = 5,
  metric = "accuracy",
  control = control_stack_grid()
)
```

### Tuning

```{r}
# Define model specification
boost_tree_spec <- boost_tree(
  mode = "classification", 
  trees = 100,
  learn_rate = 0.0208,
  # Define a tuning grid
  tree_depth = 15,  # Adjust the range based on your knowledge of the problem
  mtry = 150,  # Adjust the range based on your knowledge of the problem
  min_n = 1,  # Adjust the range based on your knowledge of the problem
  loss_reduction = 0.025,  # Adjust the range based on your 

) %>% set_engine("lightgbm")

# Define a tuning grid
# Define a more complex tuning grid
# Define a tuning grid
grid <- grid_regular(
  #tree_depth(range = c(1, 30), trans = NULL),  # Adjust the range based on your knowledge of the problem
  #trees(range = c(100, 100), trans = NULL),  # Adjust the range based on your knowledge of the problem
  #learn_rate(range = c(0.001, 0.1), trans = NULL),  # Adjust the range based on your knowledge of the problem
  #mtry(range = c(20, 100 ), trans = NULL),  # Adjust the range based on your knowledge of the problem
  #min_n(range = c(5, 100), trans = NULL),  # Adjust the range based on your knowledge of the problem
 loss_reduction(range = c(0, 0.1), trans = NULL),  # Adjust the range based on your knowledge of the problem
  levels = 5  # or another number to control the grid size
)




# Define a workflow
workflow <- workflow() %>% 
  add_model(boost_tree_spec) %>% 
  add_recipe(recipe_2)

# Run the tuning grid
tune_res <- tune_grid(
  workflow,
  resamples = train_folds,
  grid = grid
)

# View results
show_best(tune_res, metric = "accuracy")
autoplot(tune_res)
```

# Nueral Network

```{r}
#install.packages("devtools")
#devtools::install_github("tidymodels/brulee")
library(tidyverse)
library(parsnip)
library(recipes)
library(workflows)
library(brulee)
library(keras)

# Create a modified recipe based on the existing one
recipe_neural <- recipe_2 %>%
  # Add additional preprocessing steps optimized for neural network
  # For example, normalize all numeric predictors
  step_normalize(all_numeric_predictors())

# Define the neural network model with fewer epochs and hidden layers
nnet_spec <- 
  mlp(epochs = 800, hidden_units = 2, penalty = 0.01, learn_rate = 0.0608) %>% 
  set_engine("brulee", validation = 0.1) %>%  # Reserve 20% of data for validation
  set_mode("classification")

# Add early stopping
#early_stop <- EarlyStopping(patience = 10,  # Number of epochs with no improvement
                                      ##mode = "auto")  # Direction that is optimal ("auto", "min", or "max")

# Create the workflow with the neural-specific recipe
nnet_wflow <- 
  recipe_neural %>% 
  workflow(nnet_spec)  # Add early stopping callback

# Fit the model
set.seed(987)
nnet_fit <- fit(nnet_wflow, train2)

crossval_fit_net <- 
  nnet_wflow %>%
  fit_resamples(train_folds)

crossval_fit_net %>% 
  collect_metrics()

nueral_res <- 
  tune_grid(
  nnet_wflow,
  resamples = train_folds,
  grid = 5,
  metric = "accuracy",
  control = control_stack_grid()
)
```

# Stacked predictions

```{r}
test_stack <- 
  stacks() %>%
  add_candidates(log_res) %>%
  add_candidates(xgboost_res) %>%
  add_candidates(lightgbm_res) %>%
  add_candidates(C20_res) #%>%
  add_candidates(nueral_res)

test_stack <-
  test_stack %>%
  blend_predictions()

test_stack <-
  test_stack %>%
  fit_members()

test_res_stacked <- 
  test_stack %>% 
  predict(test2) %>%
  cbind(test2 %>% select(id)) %>%
  select(id, .pred_class)

test_res_stacked <- 
  test_res_stacked %>% 
  rename(action_taken = .pred_class) %>% 
  write_csv("stacked_predictions.csv")

```

